responsibilities: Build and facilitate non-consortium-based research collaborations with researchers in non-AI scientific fields (e.g., biology, physics, chemistry, quantum, fluid dynamics) to explore innovative applications of ML tools.
Co-build ML tools and models for scientific use cases, co-developing solutions and publishing pre-trained models or datasets tailored to these domains.
Educate and engage with the scientific community through tutorials, workshops, and open-source contributions to bridge the gap between ML and traditional sciences.
Foster strategic partnerships and community research initiatives with academic institutions and organizations to advance interdisciplinary innovation and adoption.
Work with industry or academic partners early in the research process and guide collaborations to the final release.
Experiment with different models and figure out how to have the most impact while working with the science machine learning community.
category: Prompt Engineering and Large Language Models (LLMs)
activity: Fine-tuning and customization of language models
analysis: The Job Responsibilities focus on building collaborations with researchers in non-AI scientific fields, developing ML tools and models for scientific use cases, and engaging with the scientific community. While these responsibilities involve machine learning, they do not specifically mention fine-tuning or customizing large language models for domain-specific tasks. The focus is more on interdisciplinary collaboration and application of ML tools in scientific domains rather than on the technical aspects of language model customization.
